content: On November 1, 1995, the Atlanta Braves celebrated a monumental achievement as they clinched the World Series title by defeating the Cleveland Indians in Game 6. The Braves secured their first championship since moving to Atlanta, with Tom Glavine delivering a masterful performance, pitching eight scoreless innings and earning the Series MVP. The victory marked the culmination of a dominant season for the Braves, who had been perennial contenders throughout the 1990s.
